choices.D: Quick mode selectors will default to those used in the firewall policy.
choices.C: The sequence number of ESP packets received from the peer will not be checked.
choices.B: There will be a DH exchange for each re-key.
choices.A: The Phase 2 will re-key even if there is no traffic.

choices.D: The output captures the dead gateway detection packets.
choices.B: The output is a phase 2 negotiation.
choices.C: The output captures the dead peer detection messages.
choices.A: The output is a phase 1 negotiation.

questions.question_text: Which IPsec mode includes the peer id information in the first packet?

choices.C: Lists the errors captured when compiling the DoS policy.
choices.B: List the real-time counters for the configured DoS policy.

questions.question_text: Identify the statement which correctly describes the output of the following command: diagnose ips anomaly list

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Should be B and D

choices.D: The FortiGate is not translating the TCP port numbers of the packets in this session.
choices.A: Session Time-To-Live (TTL) was configured to 9 seconds.
choices.B: FortiGate is doing NAT of both the source and destination IP addresses on all packets coming from the 192.168.1.110 address.
choices.C: The IP address 192.168.1.110 is being translated to 172.17.87.16.
